question: Do Brokers need to be registered on Healthcare.gov to operate on Pennie?
text:
Do Brokers need to be registered on Healthcare.gov to operate on Pennie? 
          
        
NO, if you only serve clients with marketplace coverage in Pennsylvania you only need to be certified with Pennie. If you serve both in-state and out-of-state clients, then you will need both a Healthcare.gov and Pennie account in order to serve clients in Pennsylvania and in states using the federally-facilitated marketplace (FFM). If you are a new producer (agent or broker) in Pennsylvania, and only wish to serve Pennsylvanians, you only need to be certified through Pennie.
NOTE: Others states are also transitioning to a State Based Marketplace. Many SBM states have their own certification/training requirements, you should check the requirements for each state you have clients in to continue to serve them.
